text: Can <https://github.com/invenia/NamedDims.jl> make use of sparse arrays?

Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/55043| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
Hey <@U018FJVBXPD>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!

Sure, `NamedDimsArray(sprand(5,10,0.2), (:x, :y)) * NamedDimsArray(sprand(10,0.2), :y)` seems to work. Functions specific to sparse arrays may not work, e.g. `nnz(ans)`. It would probably be trivial to make them work (likewise make sparse-array’s printing work). Perhaps open an issue, ideally with a list of what you wish would work.

text: Cool, thanks that is good to know. I'm probably going to start using it in 3/4 months time, so only then I will know what type of problems I am going to run in to.
